methods.Synopsis: Make variant query and return matching variant list. Support JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.Name: q
parameters.Description: query string. Examples: "rs58991260", "chr1:69000-70000", "dbsnp.vartype:snp". The detailed query syntax can be found at <docs url here> (coming soon)

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any variant object (e.g. http://myvariant.info/v1/variant/chr16:g.28883241A>G). Note that it supports dot notation, and wildcards as well, e.g., you can pass "dbnsfp", "dbnsfp.genename", or "dbnsfp.aa.*". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default: "all".

parameters.Name: size
parameters.Description: the maximum number of matching gene hits to return (with a cap of 1000 at the moment). Default: 10.

parameters.Name: from
parameters.Description: the number of matching gene hits to skip, starting from 0. Combining with "size" parameter, this can be useful for paging. Default: 0.

parameters.Name: sort
parameters.Description: the comma-separated fields to sort on. Prefix with "-" for descending order, otherwise in ascending order. Default: sort by matching scores in decending order.

parameters.Name: facets
parameters.Description: a single field or comma-separated fields to return facets, for example, â€œfacets=dbsnp.vartype.

parameters.Name: callback
parameters.Description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

parameters.Name: q
parameters.Description: multiple query terms seperated by comma (also support "+" or white space), but no wildcard, e.g., "q=rs58991260,rs2500"

parameters.Name: scopes
parameters.Description: specify one or more fields (separated by comma) as the search "scopes", e.g., "scopes=dbsnp.rsid", "scopes=dbsnp.rsid,dbnsfp.genename". The available "fields" can be passed to "scopes" parameter are listed here: <docs_url_here> (coming soon).

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any variant object (e.g. http://myvariant.info/v1/variant/chr16:g.28883241A>G). Note that it supports dot notation, and wildcards as well, e.g., you can pass "dbnsfp", "dbnsfp.genename", or "dbnsfp.aa.*". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default: "all".

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

methods.Synopsis: Retrieve variant annotation based on HGVS name based ids, support JSONP and CORS as well.

parameters.Name: variantid
parameters.Description: HGVS name based variant id, using genomic location based on hg19 human genome assembly, e.g. chr1:g.35367G>A, chr7:g.55241707G>T, chr16:g.28883241A>G

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any variant object (e.g. http://myvariant.info/v1/variant/chr16:g.28883241A>G). Note that it supports dot notation, and wildcards as well, e.g., you can pass "dbnsfp", "dbnsfp.genename", or "dbnsfp.aa.*". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default: "all".

parameters.Name: callback
parameters.Description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

methods.Synopsis: Make variant queries in batch for a list of HGVS name based ids

parameters.Name: ids
parameters.Description: multiple variantids seperated by comma, e.g., "ids=chr1:g.35367C>T,chr7:g.55241707G>T,chr16:g.28883241A>G". Note that currently we only take the input ids up to 1000 maximum, the rest will be omitted.

parameters.Name: fields
parameters.Description: a comma-separated fields to limit the fields returned from the matching gene hits. The supported field names can be found from any variant object (e.g. http://myvariant.info/v1/variant/chr16:g.28883241A>G). Note that it supports dot notation, and wildcards as well, e.g., you can pass "dbnsfp", "dbnsfp.genename", or "dbnsfp.aa.*". If "fields=all", all available fields will be returned. Default: "all".

parameters.Name: email
parameters.Description: If you are regular users of our services, we encourage you to provide us an email, so that we can better track the usage or follow up with you.

methods.Synopsis: Get metadata about the data available from MyVariant.info.

parameters.Name: callback
parameters.Description: you can pass a "callback" parameter to make a JSONP call.
